The processor can determine depths of various acoustic signals within a scene and generate a representation of the scene the shows the determined depths, including floorplan and volumetric representations.

titles.text: SYSTÈMES ET PROCÉDÉS POUR CAPTEURS D'IMAGERIE ACOUSTIQUE DÉTACHABLES ET ATTACHABLES
SYSTEME UND VERFAHREN FÜR LÖSBARE UND BEFESTIGBARE AKUSTISCHE BILDGEBUNGSSENSOREN
SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR DETACHABLE AND ATTACHABLE ACOUSTIC IMAGING SENSORS

abstracts.paragraph_markup: Certains systèmes comprennent un outil d'imagerie électromagnétique conçu pour recevoir un rayonnement électromagnétique, une interface de communication, un processeur en communication avec l'outil d'imagerie électromagnétique et l'interface de communication, et un boîtier. Les systèmes peuvent comprendre une première tête de capteur ayant une première pluralité d'éléments de capteur acoustique agencés dans un premier réseau de capteurs acoustiques. L'interface de communication peut assurer une communication entre le processeur et la tête de capteur par l'intermédiaire d'une communication filaire ou sans fil. L'interface de communication peut comprendre un port d'accueil en communication avec le processeur et configuré pour recevoir de manière amovible un mécanisme d'accueil correspondant de la première tête de capteur. Certains systèmes peuvent comprendre une seconde tête de capteur ayant une seconde pluralité d'éléments de capteur acoustique. La seconde tête de capteur peut être connectée de manière interchangeable à l'interface de communication et/ou à la première tête de capteur.

Certains systèmes comprennent un outil d'imagerie électromagnétique conçu pour recevoir un rayonnement électromagnétique, une interface de communication, un processeur en communication avec l'outil d'imagerie électromagnétique et l'interface de communication, et un boîtier. Les systèmes peuvent comprendre une première tête de capteur ayant une première pluralité d'éléments de capteur acoustique agencés dans un premier réseau de capteurs acoustiques. L'interface de communication peut assurer une communication entre le processeur et la tête de capteur par l'intermédiaire d'une communication filaire ou sans fil. L'interface de communication peut comprendre un port d'accueil en communication avec le processeur et configuré pour recevoir de manière amovible un mécanisme d'accueil correspondant de la première tête de capteur. Certains systèmes peuvent comprendre une seconde tête de capteur ayant une seconde pluralité d'éléments de capteur acoustique. La seconde tête de capteur peut être connectée de manière interchangeable à l'interface de communication et/ou à la première tête de capteur.

Some systems include an electromagnetic imaging tool configured to receive electromagnetic radiation, a communication interface, a processor in communication with the electromagnetic imaging tool and the communication interface, and a housing. Systems can include a first sensor head having a first plurality of acoustic sensor elements arranged in a first acoustic sensor array. The communication interface can provide communication between the processor and the sensor head via wired or wireless communication. The communication interface can comprise a docking port in communication with the processor and configured to removably receive a corresponding docking mechanism of the first sensor head. Some systems may include a second sensor head having a second plurality of acoustic sensor elements. The second sensor head may be interchangeably connectable to the communication interface and/or the first sensor head.

Some systems may include a second sensor head having a second plurality of acoustic sensor elements. The second sensor head may be interchangeably connectable to the communication interface and/or the first sensor head.

titles.text: SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR ANALYZING AND DISPLAYING ACOUSTIC DATA
SYSTEME UND VERFAHREN ZUR ANALYSE UND ANZEIGE VON AKUSTISCHEN DATEN
SYSTÈMES ET PROCÉDÉS POUR TRAITER ET AFFICHER DES DONNÉES ACOUSTIQUES

abstracts.paragraph_markup: L'invention concerne certains systèmes qui comprennent un réseau de capteurs acoustiques configuré pour recevoir des signaux acoustiques, un outil d'imagerie électromagnétique configuré pour recevoir un rayonnement électromagnétique, une interface utilisateur, un dispositif d'affichage et un processeur. Le processeur peut recevoir des données électromagnétiques provenant de l'outil d'imagerie électromagnétique et des données acoustiques provenant du réseau de capteurs acoustiques. Le processeur peut produire des données d'image acoustique de la scène sur la base des données acoustiques reçues, produire une image d'affichage comprenant des données d'image acoustique et des données d'image électromagnétique combinées, et présenter l'image d'affichage sur le dispositif d'affichage. Le processeur peut recevoir une entrée d'annotation depuis l'interface utilisateur et mettre à jour l'image d'affichage en fonction de l'entrée d'annotation reçue. Le processeur peut être configuré pour déterminer un ou plusieurs paramètres acoustiques associés au signal acoustique reçu et pour déterminer une criticité associée au signal acoustique. Un utilisateur peut annoter l'image d'affichage avec des informations de criticité déterminées ou d'autres informations déterminées.

L'invention concerne certains systèmes qui comprennent un réseau de capteurs acoustiques configuré pour recevoir des signaux acoustiques, un outil d'imagerie électromagnétique configuré pour recevoir un rayonnement électromagnétique, une interface utilisateur, un dispositif d'affichage et un processeur. Le processeur peut recevoir des données électromagnétiques provenant de l'outil d'imagerie électromagnétique et des données acoustiques provenant du réseau de capteurs acoustiques. Le processeur peut produire des données d'image acoustique de la scène sur la base des données acoustiques reçues, produire une image d'affichage comprenant des données d'image acoustique et des données d'image électromagnétique combinées, et présenter l'image d'affichage sur le dispositif d'affichage. Le processeur peut recevoir une entrée d'annotation depuis l'interface utilisateur et mettre à jour l'image d'affichage en fonction de l'entrée d'annotation reçue. Le processeur peut être configuré pour déterminer un ou plusieurs paramètres acoustiques associés au signal acoustique reçu et pour déterminer une criticité associée au signal acoustique. Un utilisateur peut annoter l'image d'affichage avec des informations de criticité déterminées ou d'autres informations déterminées.

Some systems include an acoustic sensor array configured to receive acoustic signals, an electromagnetic imaging tool configured to receive electromagnetic radiation, a user interface, a display, and a processor. The processor can receive electromagnetic data from the electromagnetic imaging tool and acoustic data from the acoustic sensor array. The processor can generate acoustic image data of the scene based on the received acoustic data, generate a display image comprising combined acoustic image data and electromagnetic image data, and present the display image on the display. The processor can receive an annotation input from the user interface and update the display image based on the received annotation input. The processor can be configured to determine one or more acoustic parameters associated with the received acoustic signal and determine a criticality associated with the acoustic signal. A user can annotated the display image with determined criticality information or other determined information.

Some systems include an acoustic sensor array configured to receive acoustic signals, an electromagnetic imaging tool configured to receive electromagnetic radiation, a user interface, a display, and a processor. The processor can receive electromagnetic data from the electromagnetic imaging tool and acoustic data from the acoustic sensor array. The processor can generate acoustic image data of the scene based on the received acoustic data, generate a display image comprising combined acoustic image data and electromagnetic image data, and present the display image on the display. The processor can receive an annotation input from the user interface and update the display image based on the received annotation input. The processor can be configured to determine one or more acoustic parameters associated with the received acoustic signal and determine a criticality associated with the acoustic signal. A user can annotated the display image with determined criticality information or other determined information.

titles.text: SYSTEMS AND METHODS FOR REPRESENTING ACOUSTIC SIGNATURES FROM A TARGET SCENE
SYSTÈMES ET PROCÉDÉS DE REPRÉSENTATION DE SIGNATURES ACOUSTIQUES D'UNE SCÈNE CIBLE
SYSTEME UND VERFAHREN ZUR DARSTELLUNG AKUSTISCHER SIGNATUREN VON EINER ZIELSZENE

abstracts.paragraph_markup: L'invention concerne des systèmes d'imagerie acoustique qui peuvent comprendre un réseau de détection acoustique, un outil d'imagerie électromagnétique, un affichage et un dispositif audio. Un processeur peut recevoir des données provenant du réseau de capteurs acoustiques et de l'outil d'imagerie électromagnétique pour produire une image d'affichage combinant des données d'image acoustique et des données d'image électromagnétique. Les systèmes peuvent comprendre un dispositif audio qui reçoit une sortie audio provenant du processeur et délivre des signaux de rétroaction audio à un utilisateur. Les signaux de rétroaction audio peuvent représenter des signaux acoustiques d'une scène acoustique. Les systèmes peuvent fournir une image d'affichage à un utilisateur comprenant des données d'image acoustique, et un utilisateur peut sélectionner un signal acoustique pour lequel fournir une sortie audio correspondante à un dispositif audio. Des sorties audio et des images d'affichage peuvent changer de manière dynamique en réponse à un changement de pointage du réseau de détection acoustique, par exemple en changeant une sortie audio stéréo.

L'invention concerne des systèmes d'imagerie acoustique qui peuvent comprendre un réseau de détection acoustique, un outil d'imagerie électromagnétique, un affichage et un dispositif audio. Un processeur peut recevoir des données provenant du réseau de capteurs acoustiques et de l'outil d'imagerie électromagnétique pour produire une image d'affichage combinant des données d'image acoustique et des données d'image électromagnétique. Les systèmes peuvent comprendre un dispositif audio qui reçoit une sortie audio provenant du processeur et délivre des signaux de rétroaction audio à un utilisateur. Les signaux de rétroaction audio peuvent représenter des signaux acoustiques d'une scène acoustique. Les systèmes peuvent fournir une image d'affichage à un utilisateur comprenant des données d'image acoustique, et un utilisateur peut sélectionner un signal acoustique pour lequel fournir une sortie audio correspondante à un dispositif audio. Des sorties audio et des images d'affichage peuvent changer de manière dynamique en réponse à un changement de pointage du réseau de détection acoustique, par exemple en changeant une sortie audio stéréo.

Acoustic imaging systems can include an acoustic sensing array, an electromagnetic imaging tool, a display, and an audio device. A processor can receive data from the acoustic sensor array and the electromagnetic imaging tool to generate a display image combining acoustic image data and electromagnetic image data. Systems can include an audio device that receives an audio output from the processor and outputs audio feedback signals to a user. The audio feedback signals can represent acoustic signals from an acoustic scene. Systems can provide a display image to a user including acoustic image data, and a user can select an acoustic signal for which to provide a corresponding audio output to an audio device. Audio outputs and display images can change dynamically in response to a change in pointing of the acoustic sensing array, such as by changing a stereo audio output.

Acoustic imaging systems can include an acoustic sensing array, an electromagnetic imaging tool, a display, and an audio device. A processor can receive data from the acoustic sensor array and the electromagnetic imaging tool to generate a display image combining acoustic image data and electromagnetic image data. Systems can include an audio device that receives an audio output from the processor and outputs audio feedback signals to a user. The audio feedback signals can represent acoustic signals from an acoustic scene. Systems can provide a display image to a user including acoustic image data, and a user can select an acoustic signal for which to provide a corresponding audio output to an audio device. Audio outputs and display images can change dynamically in response to a change in pointing of the acoustic sensing array, such as by changing a stereo audio output.

abstracts.paragraph_markup: La présente invention concerne un dispositif de commande de stockage, couplé à un dispositif de stockage et situé à distance d'un dispositif hôte, qui reçoit des données d'objet multimédias en provenance du dispositif hôte. Le dispositif de commande de stockage identifie un type des données d'objets multimédias et sélectionne, sur la base du type identifié, un modèle de calcul parmi une pluralité de modèles de calcul à utiliser par un moteur de calcul du dispositif de commande de stockage. Le moteur de calcul utilise le modèle de calcul sélectionné pour générer des métadonnées décrivant les données d'objets multimédias. Les métadonnées sont stockées dans le dispositif de stockage afin d'être récupérées de manière sélective dans le dispositif de stockage séparément des données d'objets multimédias.

A storage control device coupled to a storage device and located remotely from a host device receives media object data from the host device. The storage control device identifies a type of the media object data and select, based on the identified type, a computational model from among a plurality of computational models for use by a computational engine of the storage control device. The computational engine uses the selected computational model to generate metadata describing the media object data. The metadata is stored in the storage device so as to be selectively retrievable from the storage device separately from the media object data.

This disclosure describes a storage aggregator controller with metadata computation control, The storage aggregator controller communicates, via a host interface, over a computer network with one or more remote hosts, and also communicates, via a storage device interface, with a plurality of local storage devices, which are separate from the remote host(s) and which have respective non-volatile memories. The storage aggregator controller manages the local storage devices for storage or retrieval of media objects. The storage aggregator controller also governs a selective computation, at aggregator control circuitry or at a storage device controller of one or more of the storage devices, of metadata that defines content characteristics of the media objects that are retrieved from the plurality of storage devices or that are received from the one or more hosts over the computer network for storage in the plurality of storage devices.

Metadata computation apparatus (56) includes a host interface (68), a storage interface (60) and one or more processors (64). The host interface is configured to communicate over a computer network (28) with one or more remote hosts (24). The storage interface is configured to communicate with one or more non-volatile memories (52) of one or more storage devices (44). The processors are configured to manage local storage or retrieval of media objects in the non-volatile memories, to compute metadata for a plurality of media objects that are stored, or are en-route for storage, on the storage devices, wherein the media objects are of multiple media types, wherein the computed metadata tags a target feature in the media objects of at least two different media types among the multiple media types, and to store, in the non-volatile memories, the metadata tagging the target feature found in the at least two different media types, for use by the hosts.

abstracts.paragraph_markup: Cette invention concerne un système à ultrasons qui produit des images 3D à une fréquence élevée d'images d'affichage. Une région volumétrique est balayée avec des ondes planes ou des faisceaux d'émission divergents pour insonifier une grande partie ou même l'ensemble de la région volumétrique avec chaque événement d'émission. Afin d'éviter l'acquisition de signaux de fouillis dans les dimensions d'azimut et d'élévation, les ondes planes ou les faisceaux divergents sont transmis à des angles intermédiaires entre les directions d'élévation et d'azimut. En transmettant des ondes planes ou des faisceaux divergents à de multiples angles différents dont chacun est une combinaison des directions d'élévation et d'azimut, le fouillis de lobes secondaires est réduit dans les images composées résultantes.

En transmettant des ondes planes ou des faisceaux divergents à de multiples angles différents dont chacun est une combinaison des directions d'élévation et d'azimut, le fouillis de lobes secondaires est réduit dans les images composées résultantes.

An ultrasound system produces 3D images at a high framerate of display. A volumetric region is scanned with plane wave or diverging transmit beams to insonify a large part of or even the entire volumetric region with each transmit event. To avoid the acquisition of clutter signals in the azimuth and elevation dimensions, the plane waves or diverging beams are transmitted at angles intermediate the elevation and azimuth directions. By transmitting plane waves or diverging beams at multiple different angles which are each a combination of both the elevation and azimuth directions, sidelobe clutter is reduced in the resulting compounded images.

abstracts.paragraph_markup: L'invention concerne un appareil permettant de reproduire une source sonore étendue spatialement ayant une position et une géométrie définies dans un espace, l'appareil comprenant une interface (100) pour recevoir une position d'auditeur ; un projecteur (120) pour calculer une projection d'une coque bidimensionnelle ou tridimensionnelle associée à la source sonore étendue spatialement sur un plan de projection à l'aide de la position de l'auditeur, des informations sur la géométrie de la source sonore étendue spatialement, et des informations sur la position de la source sonore étendue spatialement ; un calculateur de position sonore (140) pour calculer des positions d'au moins deux sources sonores pour la source sonore étendue spatialement à l'aide du plan de projection ; et un moteur de rendu (160) pour rendre lesdites au moins deux sources sonores au niveau des positions pour obtenir une reproduction de la source sonore étendue spatialement ayant au moins deux signaux de sortie, le moteur de rendu (160) étant configuré pour utiliser différents signaux sonores pour les différentes positions, les différents signaux sonores étant associés à la source sonore étendue spatialement.

Apparatus for reproducing a spatially extended sound source having a defined position and geometry in a space, the apparatus comprises an interface (100) for receiving a listener position; a projector (120) for calculating a projection of a two-dimensional or three-dimensional hull associated with the spatially extended sound source onto a projection plane using the listener position, information on the geometry of the spatially extended sound source, and information on the position of the spatially extended sound source; a sound position calculator (140) for calculating positions of at least two sound sources for the spatially extended sound source using the projection plane; and a renderer (160) for rendering the at least two sound sources at the positions to obtain a reproduction of the spatially extended sound source having two or more output signals, wherein the renderer (160) is configured to use different sound signals for the different positions, wherein the different sound signals are associated with the spatially extended sound source.

abstracts.paragraph_markup:
Method for ultrasound imaging comprising at least the following steps:
a) a transmission step in which a plurality of ultrasonic waves are transmitted into an imaged region and a set of raw data is acquired by an array of transducers in response to each ultrasonic wave, the ultrasonic waves having different spatial frequency content;
b) a coherence enhancing step in which, for each of a plurality of virtual transmit focal zones in the imaged region, at least one set of coherent data is synthesized from the sets of raw data;
c) a beamforming step in which, for each of a plurality of locations included in each of the virtual transmit focal zones, an image pixel is computed by beamforming, using the set of coherent data.

Method for ultrasound imaging comprising at least the following steps:a) a transmission step in which a plurality of ultrasonic waves are transmitted into an imaged region and a set of raw data is acquired by an array of transducers in response to each ultrasonic wave, the ultrasonic waves having different spatial frequency content;b) a coherence enhancing step in which, for each of a plurality of virtual transmit focal zones in the imaged region, at least one set of coherent data is synthesized from the sets of raw data;c) a beamforming step in which, for each of a plurality of locations included in each of the virtual transmit focal zones, an image pixel is computed by beamforming, using the set of coherent data.

abstracts.paragraph_markup: Appareil de reproduction d'une source sonore étendue spatialement ayant une position ou orientation et une géométrie définies dans un espace, l'appareil comprenant une interface (100) pour recevoir une position d'auditeur ; un projecteur (120) pour calculer une projection d'une coque bidimensionnelle ou tridimensionnelle associée à la source sonore étendue spatialement sur un plan de projection à l'aide de la position d'auditeur, des informations concernant la géométrie de la source sonore étendue spatialement, et des informations concernant la position de la source sonore étendue spatialement ; un calculateur de position de son (140) pour calculer des positions de deux sources sonores ou plus pour la source sonore étendue spatialement à l'aide du plan de projection ; et un moteur de rendu (160) pour rendre les deux sources sonores ou plus à des positions pour obtenir une reproduction de la source sonore étendue spatialement ayant deux signaux de sortie ou plus, le moteur de rendu (160) étant conçu pour utiliser différents signaux sonores pour les différentes positions, les différents signaux sonores étant associés à la source sonore étendue spatialement, et le moteur de rendu (160) étant conçu pour rendre les deux sources sonores ou plus par rapport à un emplacement et/ou une orientation fixes de la source sonore étendue spatialement en réponse à une information spécifique reçue.

Apparatus for reproducing a spatially extended sound source having a defined position or orientation and geometry in a space, the apparatus comprises an interface ( 100) for receiving a listener position; a projector (120) for calculating a projection of a two-dimensional or three-dimensional hull associated with the spatially extended sound source onto a projection plane using the listener position, information on the geometry of the spatially extended sound source, and information on the position of the spatially extended sound source; a sound position calculator (140) for calculating positions of at least two sound sources for the spatially extended sound source using the projection plane; and a renderer (160) for rendering the at least two sound sources at the positions to obtain a reproduction of the spatially extended sound source having two or more output signals, wherein the renderer (160) is configured to use different sound signals for the different positions, wherein the different sound signals are associated with the spatially extended sound source, and wherein the renderer (160) is configured for rendering the at least two sound sources relative to a fixed location and/or orientation of the spatially extended sound source in response to a specific information received.

abstracts.paragraph_markup: This disclosure describes a storage aggregator controller with metadata computation control. The storage aggregator controller communicates, via a host interface, over a computer network with one or more remote hosts, and also communicates, via a storage device interface, with a plurality of local storage devices, which are separate from the remote host(s) and which have respective non-volatile memories. The storage aggregator controller manages the local storage devices for storage or retrieval of media objects. The storage aggregator controller also governs a selective computation, at aggregator control circuitry or at a storage device controller of one or more of the storage devices, of metadata that defines content characteristics of the media objects that are retrieved from the plurality of storage devices or that are received from the one or more hosts over the computer network for storage in the plurality of storage devices.

This disclosure describes a storage aggregator controller with metadata computation control. The storage aggregator controller manages the local storage devices for storage or retrieval of media objects. The storage aggregator controller also governs a selective computation, at aggregator control circuitry or at a storage device controller of one or more of the storage devices, of metadata that defines content characteristics of the media objects that are retrieved from the plurality of storage devices or that are received from the one or more hosts over the computer network for storage in the plurality of storage devices.

abstracts.paragraph_markup: A storage control device coupled to a storage device and located remotely from a host device receives media object data from the host device. The storage control device identifies a type of the media object data and select, based on the identified type, a computational model from among a plurality of computational models for use by a computational engine of the storage control device. The computational engine uses the selected computational model to generate metadata describing the media object data. The metadata is stored in the storage device so as to be selectively retrievable from the storage device separately from the media object data.

The computational engine uses the selected computational model to generate metadata describing the media object data. The metadata is stored in the storage device so as to be selectively retrievable from the storage device separately from the media object data.

abstracts.paragraph_markup: Metadata computation apparatus (56) includes a host interface (68), a storage interface (60) and one or more processors (64). The host interface is configured to communicate over a computer network (28) with one or more remote hosts (24). The storage interface is configured to communicate with one or more non-volatile memories (52) of one or more storage devices (44). The processors are configured to manage local storage or retrieval of media objects in the non-volatile memories, to compute metadata for a plurality of media objects that are stored, or are en-route for storage, on the storage devices, wherein the media objects are of multiple media types, wherein the computed metadata tags a target feature in the media objects of at least two different media types among the multiple media types, and to store, in the non-volatile memories, the metadata tagging the target feature found in the at least two different media types, for use by the hosts.

abstracts.paragraph_markup: Disclosed is an AI acoustic camera including an acoustic source localizing means unit of generating position-specific acoustic level data by determining a position of an acoustic source, an AI acoustic analysis unit of recognizing a type of acoustic source estimated as an abnormal acoustic source by extracting a regeneration time domain acoustic signal for the acoustic source with the determined position and AI-learning and recognizing an acoustic feature image of the extracted time domain acoustic signal, an object recognition unit of recognizing a type of object positioned in the acoustic source through image analysis of an area recognized as that the acoustic source is positioned, and a determination unit of determining the acoustic source as a true acoustic source when the type of acoustic source and the type of object have commonality.

Disclosed is an AI acoustic camera including an acoustic source localizing means unit of generating position-specific acoustic level data by determining a position of an acoustic source, an AI acoustic analysis unit of recognizing a type of acoustic source estimated as an abnormal acoustic source by extracting a regeneration time domain acoustic signal for the acoustic source with the determined position and AI-learning and recognizing an acoustic feature image of the extracted time domain acoustic signal, an object recognition unit of recognizing a type of object positioned in the acoustic source through image analysis of an area recognized as that the acoustic source is positioned, and a determination unit of determining the acoustic source as a true acoustic source when the type of acoustic source and the type of object have commonality.

titles.text: Ultrasound Method and Apparatus
Real-time pattern recognition and automatic interpretation of acoustic reflection images
Fetal section determination method and device based on ultrasonic dynamic image
Real-time pattern recognition and automatic interpretation of acoustic reflection images

abstracts.paragraph_markup: Methods, systems, devices, and products for performing well logging in a borehole intersecting an earth formation to obtain and transmit an acoustic reflection image of the formation. Methods include identifying a set of features in the acoustic reflection image substantially fitting a pattern, wherein the set of features corresponds to a portion of at least one reflecting structural interface of the formation; and using a representation of the pattern as the compressed representation of the acoustic reflection image. The features may be amplitude peaks in the acoustic reflection image, and the pattern may be a line segment therein that is obtained from the amplitude peaks. Identifying the set of features may include generating a binary image of the amplitude peaks.

titles.text: Real-time pattern recognition and automatic interpretation of acoustic reflection images
Fetal section determination method and device based on ultrasonic dynamic image

abstracts.paragraph_markup: A fetal section determination method and device based on an ultrasonic dynamic image. The method comprises: sequentially inputting each frame of fetal ultrasound image among multiple frames of obtained continuous fetal ultrasound images into a predetermined feature detection model for analysis (101); obtaining analysis results sequentially output by the feature detection model to serve as feature information of each frame of fetal ultrasound image (102); and determining, according to the category of a part feature of each frame of fetal ultrasound image and the category of a structural feature of the fetal ultrasound image, a section corresponding to the fetal ultrasound image (103). According to the method, the sections of the fetal ultrasound images are determined by obtaining the part features and the structural features of the multiple frames of continuous fetal ultrasound images and combining the part features and the structural features of the fetal ultrasound images, such that the determination accuracy of the sections of the fetal ultrasound images can be improved, the standardization degree of the sections of the fetal ultrasound images can be improved, and the determination efficiency of the sections of the fetal ultrasound images can also be improved.

abstracts.paragraph_markup: Apparatus and method for generating a DC pixel voltage are disclosed. The apparatus includes an amphfier con¬figured to amplify an input signal to generate a voltage signal, wherein the input signal is generated in response to an ultrasonic wave reflecting off an item-to-be-imaged and propagating via a piezoelectric layer; a noise reduction circuit configured to pass the voltage signal from an output of the amplifier to a node, while reducing a propagation of noise from the output of the amphfier to the node; and a circuit configured to generate a DC pixel voltage based on the reduced- noise voltage signal.

abstracts.paragraph_markup: The present description relates to an ultrasound imaging device comprising a set (100) of ultrasound transducers (103) distributed into a plurality of subsets (105) of P transducers (103), the device comprising, for each subset (105): - K transceiver circuits (123k); and - a configurable routing circuit (125) connecting the P transducers (103) of the subset (105) to the K transceiver circuits (123k), P and K being integers greater than or equal to 2, with K strictly less than P, and each subset (105) comprising at least one transducer, referred to as the mobile transducer, which may be disconnected or connected, via the routing circuit (125), to any one of several transceiver circuits (123k) predefined among the K transceiver circuits (123k) of the subset.

abstracts.paragraph_markup:
【課題】検査対象物の超音波による内部検査の精度を向上させ、自動判定が可能な３次元超音波画像化装置を提供することを目的とする。
【解決手段】本発明に係る３次元超音波画像化装置１０は、複数の圧電振動子２２を有する超音波トランスジューサ１１と、この超音波トランスジューサから超音波を発振させる圧電振動子２２を選択する駆動素子選択部１３と、選択された圧電振動子から発振される超音波を検査対象物１４に入射させ、この検査対象物１４からの反射エコーを受信し、その反射エコーの電気信号を検出する信号検出回路１６と、検出された反射エコーの電気信号を並列演算処理により、３次元画像化データＩを生成する信号処理部１７と、この信号処理部１７からの３次元画像化データＩを取り込み、このデータＩの画像化強度分布を平坦化するように、前記３次元画像データＩの画像輝度補正を行ない、補正結果を表示する表示処理装置１８とを有するものである。
【選択図】 図１

<P>PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an ultrasonic imaging apparatus constituted so as to enhance the precision of the internal inspection due to ultrasonic waves of an object to be inspected to enable automatic determination. <P>SOLUTION: The three-dimensional ultrasonic imaging apparatus has an ultrasonic transducer 11 having a plurality of piezoelectric vibrators 22; a drive element selecting part 13 for selecting the piezoelectric vibrators 22 for oscillating ultrasonic waves from the ultrasonic transducer; a signal detecting circuit 16 for making the ultrasonic waves oscillated from the selected piezoelectric vibrator incident on the object 14 to be inspected, and receiving the reflected echo from the object 14 to be inspected to detect the electrical signal of the reflected echo; a signal processing part 17 for subjecting the detected electrical signal of the reflected echo to parallel operational processing, to form three-dimensional imaging data I; and a display processing device 18 for fetching the three-dimensional imaging data I from the signal processing part 17, to perform the image brightness correction of the three-dimensional imaging data I so as to flatten the imaging intensity distribution of the data I so as to display the correction result. <P>COPYRIGHT: (C)2006,JPO&NCIPI

An object of the present invention is to provide a three-dimensional ultrasonic imaging apparatus capable of improving the accuracy of internal inspection of an inspection object using ultrasonic waves and capable of automatic determination.
A three-dimensional ultrasonic imaging apparatus according to the present invention selects an ultrasonic transducer having a plurality of piezoelectric vibrators and a piezoelectric vibrator that oscillates ultrasonic waves from the ultrasonic transducers. A signal that causes the ultrasonic wave oscillated from the element selection unit 13 and the selected piezoelectric vibrator to enter the inspection object 14, receives a reflected echo from the inspection object 14, and detects an electrical signal of the reflected echo The detection circuit 16, the signal processing unit 17 that generates the three-dimensional imaging data I by parallel calculation processing of the detected electrical signal of the reflected echo, and the three-dimensional imaging data I from the signal processing unit 17 are captured, A display processing device 18 for performing image brightness correction of the three-dimensional image data I and displaying the correction result so as to flatten the imaging intensity distribution of the data I; Than it is.

abstracts.paragraph_markup:
【課題】実効的な送受波の感度を低下させずにダイアフラム型超音波トランスデューサとしての周波数帯域幅を広げる。
【解決手段】ダイアフラム型超音波トランスデューサのダイアフラム６の上又は内部に梁構造７を形成する。ダイアフラムの直径は同じで、梁の幅の異なる複数のダイアフラムを電気的に同時に駆動することで、ダイアフラムの隙間を抑制しつつ、広帯域化を実現する。
【選択図】図１

<P>PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To enhance a frequency bandwidth as a diaphragm type ultrasonic transducer, without decreasing the effective sensitivity of the transmission/reception waves. <P>SOLUTION: A beam structure 7 is formed on the top or the inside of a diaphragm 6 of the diaphragm-type ultrasonic transducer. A plurality of diaphragms, having the same dimension of the diaphragms and different widths of beams, are simultaneously driven electrically, thereby achieving wide band, while suppressing the gap between the diaphragms. <P>COPYRIGHT: (C)2008,JPO&INPIT

An object of the present invention is to widen the frequency bandwidth of a diaphragm type ultrasonic transducer without degrading the sensitivity of effective transmission / reception waves.
A beam structure 7 is formed on or in a diaphragm 6 of a diaphragm type ultrasonic transducer. A plurality of diaphragms having the same diaphragm diameter and different beam widths are electrically driven simultaneously, thereby realizing a wide band while suppressing a gap between the diaphragms.

abstracts.paragraph_markup:
【課題】超音波受信素子で得られた信号の強度が弱い場合であっても、超音波を反射した物体の３次元的位置と３次元的形状を明瞭に画像化すること。
【解決手段】超音波発信素子から発射した超音波を対象物に当てて反射させ、この反射波を複数の超音波受信素子を配列してなる超音波アレイセンサにより受信し、各受信素子で得られた信号強度と送受波時間との関係に基づいて前記対象物の空間形状を画像化する超音波画像化方法において、各受信素子で得られる信号強度の受信波形における信号強度が増大から減少に転ずる極大点の前後に、信号強度が減少から増大に転ずる一対の極小点を有する複数の受信波形の中から、極大点の信号強度が大きい方から所定数の受信波形を記憶手段に記憶させ、この記憶させた所定数の受信波形に基づいて前記対象物の３次元的位置と３次元的形状を画像化することを特徴とする超音波画像化方法。
【選択図】図２

<P>PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To clearly image a three-dimensional position and a three-dimensional shape of an object reflecting an ultrasonic wave, even when the intensity of a signal acquired by an ultrasonic reception element is weak. <P>SOLUTION: In an ultrasonic imaging method, an ultrasonic wave emitted from an ultrasonic emission element is hit on an object and reflected thereby, and the reflected wave is received by an ultrasonic array sensor formed by arraying a plurality of ultrasonic reception elements, and a spatial shape of the object is imaged based on the relationship between a signal intensity acquired by each reception element and a wave transmission/reception time. The ultrasonic imaging method has characteristics wherein a prescribed number of reception waveforms are stored in a storage means, which are selected in the order of greatness of the signal intensity of a maximal point from a plurality of received waveforms having a pair of minimal points where the signal intensity is changed from a decreasing state to an increasing state before or after the maximal point where the signal intensity is changed from an increasing state to a decreasing state in the reception waveform of the signal intensity acquired by each reception element, and the three-dimensional position and the three-dimensional shape of the object are imaged based on the stored prescribed number of reception waveforms. <P>COPYRIGHT: (C)2008,JPO&INPIT

To clearly image a three-dimensional position and a three-dimensional shape of an object reflecting ultrasonic waves even when the intensity of a signal obtained by an ultrasonic receiving element is weak.
An ultrasonic wave emitted from an ultrasonic wave transmitting element is applied to an object and reflected, and the reflected wave is received by an ultrasonic array sensor in which a plurality of ultrasonic wave receiving elements are arranged, and obtained by each receiving element. In the ultrasonic imaging method for imaging the spatial shape of the object based on the relationship between the received signal strength and the transmission / reception time, the signal strength in the received waveform of the signal strength obtained by each receiving element is decreased from the increase Before and after the rolling maximum point, among a plurality of received waveforms having a pair of local minimum points where the signal strength changes from decreasing to increasing, a predetermined number of receiving waveforms are stored in the storage means from the one with the highest signal strength at the local maximum point, An ultrasonic imaging method comprising imaging a three-dimensional position and a three-dimensional shape of the object based on the stored predetermined number of received waveforms.
[Selection] Figure 2

titles.text: 超音波映像装置
ULTRASONIC IMAGING EQUIPMENT

abstracts.paragraph_markup:
【課題】反射信号のエコー強度のレベル変動に依存せず位相成分を正確に抽出でき、被検査体内の欠陥を常に正確に再現性よく安定して検出できる超音波映像装置を提供する。
【解決手段】超音波映像装置は、反射信号に係るディジタル波形のデータを演算処理する信号演算処理部１６を有し、この信号演算処理部は、ディジタル波形のデータを、超音波探触子の中心周波数を用いて、直交演算して同相成分と直交成分を出力する直交検波部２１と、ローパスフィルタ２２１，２２２と、同相成分と直交成分に基づいてディジタル波形に含まれる周波数成分の位相を算出する位相演算部３３，３４と、位相差を算出する位相差算出部３５を含む。この位相差算部から出力された位相差に基づいて表示装置１７の画面に画像を表示する。
【選択図】図３

<P>PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an ultrasonic imaging equipment for accurately extracting a phase component without depending on a level variation of echo intensity of a reflective signal, and of always accurately and stably detecting with improved reproducibility a defect in an object to be inspected. <P>SOLUTION: The ultrasonic imaging equipment includes a signal processing section 16 processing data of digital waveform according to a reflective signal. The signal processing section includes an orthogonal wave-detecting section 21 performing an orthogonal processing of data of the digital waveform by using a central frequency of an ultrasonic probe output an inphase component and an orthogonal component; low pass filters 221, 222; phase processing sections 33, 34 calculating a phase of a frequency component contained in the digital waveform based on the inphase component and the orthogonal component; and a phase-contrast calculating section 35 calculating a phase-contrast. Based on the phase-contrast output by the phase-contrast calculating section, an image is displayed on a screen of a displaying apparatus 17. <P>COPYRIGHT: (C)2009,JPO&INPIT

An ultrasound imaging apparatus capable of accurately extracting a phase component without depending on a level fluctuation of an echo intensity of a reflected signal, and capable of always detecting a defect in an inspected object accurately and stably with high reproducibility.
An ultrasonic imaging apparatus includes a signal calculation processing unit 16 for calculating and processing digital waveform data related to a reflected signal. The signal calculation processing unit converts digital waveform data into an ultrasonic probe. Using the center frequency, the quadrature detection unit 21 that performs quadrature operation and outputs the in-phase component and the quadrature component, the low-pass filters 221, 222, and calculates the phase of the frequency component included in the digital waveform based on the in-phase component and the quadrature component Including phase calculation units 33 and 34 and a phase difference calculation unit 35 for calculating a phase difference. Based on the phase difference output from the phase difference calculator, an image is displayed on the screen of the display device 17.
[Selection] Figure 3

titles.text: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR ULTRASONIC SYNTHETIC IMAGING
超音波合成イメージングの装置と方法

abstracts.paragraph_markup:
【課題】平面波合成超音波イメージングの方法の改善を可能とする新しい合成超音波イメージングの方法を提供する。
【解決手段】
本発明に係る超音波イメージングの方法は少なくとも、
ａ）送信工程であって、複数の超音波が画像化領域へ送信され、それぞれのローデータの集合はそれぞれの超音波に応じたトランスデューサのアレイによって取得され、該超音波はさまざまな空間周波数成分を有するものと、
ｂ）コヒーレンス向上工程であって、該画像化領域の複数の仮の送信焦点域それぞれについて、該ローデータの各集合から少なくとも一のコヒーレントデータの集合が合成されるものと、
ｃ）整相工程であって、それぞれの該仮の送信焦点域に含まれる複数の場所それぞれについて、イメージ画素が該コヒーレントデータの集合を利用した整相によって演算されるものと、
を備える。
【選択図】図２

<P>PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a novel method for an ultrasonic synthetic imaging can improve a method of plane wave ultrasonic synthetic imaging. <P>SOLUTION: This method for ultrasonic imaging is provided with at least the following steps: (a) a transmission step in which a plurality of ultrasonic waves are transmitted into an imaged region and a set of raw data is obtained by an array of transducers in response to each ultrasonic wave, the ultrasonic waves have different spatial frequency content; (b) a coherence enhancing step in which, for each of a plurality of virtual transmit focal zones in the imaged region, at least one set of coherent data is synthesized from the sets of raw data; (c) a beamforming step in which, for each of a plurality of locations included in each of the virtual transmit focal zones, an image pixel is computed by beamforming, using the set of coherent data. <P>COPYRIGHT: (C)2010,JPO&INPIT

The present invention provides a new method of synthetic ultrasonic imaging that can improve the method of plane wave synthetic ultrasonic imaging.
[Solution]
The ultrasonic imaging method according to the present invention includes at least:
a) a transmission step, wherein a plurality of ultrasonic waves are transmitted to the imaging region, each raw data set being acquired by an array of transducers corresponding to each ultrasonic wave, the ultrasonic waves having different spatial frequency components And having
b) a coherence enhancement step, wherein for each of a plurality of provisional transmission focal regions of the imaging region, at least one set of coherent data is synthesized from each set of raw data;
c) a phasing step in which, for each of a plurality of locations included in each of the temporary transmission focal regions, an image pixel is calculated by phasing using the set of coherent data;
Is provided.
[Selection] Figure 2

Stereoscopic image processing by acoustic distortion change and acoustic defocusing

abstracts.paragraph_markup:
【課題】
広い領域からの情報を使用して、知られた物質内に含まれる散乱物体の音響画像処理情報を迅速に収集させる。
【解決手段】
本発明は平面画像からの情報を利用して散乱構造物の立体音響画像処理を行うシステムに関する。このシステムは特徴的センサアレイ３００を使用してセンサアレイ３００から対象物体内に信号を放出し、対象物体の平面表示を発生させる。この平面表示は複数のｘとｙの座標対と少なくとも１つの候補散乱構造物１０６とを含む。候補散乱構造物１０６形状は少なくとも１対のｘとｙの座標に限定される。続いてこの候補散乱構造物１０６のｘとｙの座標対は第１座標依存応答関数と比較され、散乱構造物のｘ、ｙおよびｚの位置を立体空間に振り分ける。
【選択図】図３

【Task】
Information from a wide area is used to quickly collect acoustic image processing information of scattered objects contained within known materials.
[Solution]
The present invention relates to a system that performs stereoacoustic image processing of a scattering structure using information from a planar image. The system uses the characteristic sensor array 300 to emit signals from the sensor array 300 into the target object and generate a planar display of the target object. The planar display includes a plurality of x and y coordinate pairs and at least one candidate scattering structure 106. The candidate scattering structure 106 shape is limited to at least one pair of x and y coordinates. Subsequently, the x and y coordinate pairs of the candidate scattering structure 106 are compared with the first coordinate-dependent response function, and the x, y, and z positions of the scattering structure are allocated to the three-dimensional space.
[Selection] Figure 3

abstracts.paragraph_markup:
An ultrasonic transducer, an ultrasonic probe, and an ultrasonic imaging apparatus capable of improving the performance of ultrasonic transmission / reception with a simple structure.
In an ultrasonic transducer, an inner diaphragm layer having a gap is formed on a lower electrode (first electrode) formed on a substrate, and an upper electrode (first electrode) is formed on the inner diaphragm layer. 2) and the outer diaphragm layer 5b are formed in this order, and the beam 7 connecting the opposing vertices of the diaphragm is formed on the outer diaphragm layer 5b. The lower electrode 2 and the upper electrode 3 are opposed to each other via an inner diaphragm layer 5a having a gap 4 inside, and constitute a capacitor.

【課題】簡単な構造で超音波送受信の性能を向上させることができる超音波トランスデューサ、超音波探触子および超音波撮像装置を提供する。
【解決手段】超音波トランスデューサは、基板１上に形成した下部電極２（第１の電極）の上に、内部に空隙４を有する内側ダイヤフラム層５ａを形成し、その上に上部電極３（第２の電極）、外側ダイヤフラム層５ｂを順に形成し、さらに外側ダイヤフラム層５ｂの上にダイヤフラムの対向する頂点間を結ぶ梁７を形成したものである。下部電極２と上部電極３とは、内部に空隙４を有する内側ダイヤフラム層５ａを介して対向し、コンデンサを構成する。
【選択図】図６

PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an ultrasonic transducer which is capable of improving ultrasonic wave transmission/reception performance with a simple structure, and to provide an ultrasonic probe and an ultrasonic imaging apparatus.SOLUTION: In the ultrasonic transducer, an inner diaphragm layer 5a having a gap 4 thereinside is formed on a lower electrode 2 (first electrode) formed on a substrate 1, an upper electrode 3 (second electrode) and an outer diaphragm layer 5b are sequentially formed on the inner diaphragm layer 5a, and beams 7 connecting vertices facing each other of a diaphragm are formed on the outer diaphragm layer 5b. A capacitor is configured so that the lower electrode 2 and the upper electrode 3 face each other via the inner diaphragm layer 5a having the gap 4 thereinside.

撮像システムおよび撮像方法

abstracts.paragraph_markup:
【課題】非破壊試験に関し、特に超音波イメージングに関する。トランスデューサ素子からなるアレイを有する携帯型の超音波撮像システムを動作させる、適応型のビーム形成の撮像方法が開示される。
【解決手段】この方法は、アレイ20における異なるサブアパーチャ1-3を用いて、それぞれの送信に伴う複数のビーム形成の超音波信号を送信するステップと、反射超音波信号を受信して、それぞれの個別のサブアパーチャの送信のもとでのＤＡＳのビーム形成をもたらすステップとを含む。それぞれのサブアパーチャの送信からの、受信され時間遅延した信号におけるコヒーレントエネルギーの割合に基づいてコヒーレンス係数が計算される。定められたサブアパーチャの送信のもとでのすべてのビーム形成のイメージングは、適応可能なコヒーレンスで重み付けされ、最終的なビーム形成の出力に合成される。
【選択図】図２

PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an adaptive imaging method for beam forming, operating a portable ultrasound imaging system having an array of transducer elements, generally regarding non-destructive testing and, more particularly, to ultrasound imaging.SOLUTION: The method comprises the steps of: transmitting a plurality of ultrasound signals for beam forming associated with each transmission, using a different sub-aperture 1-3 of an array 20; receiving reflected ultrasound signals to cause DAS beam forming under each individual sub-aperture transmission. A coherency factor is calculated based on the proportion of coherent energy in the received and delayed signals from each sub-aperture transmission. The imaging of all beam forming under the defined sub-aperture transmission is weighted by the adaptable coherency to be synthesized into outputs of final beam forming.

The present invention relates to nondestructive testing, and more particularly to ultrasonic imaging. An adaptive beamforming imaging method is disclosed for operating a portable ultrasound imaging system having an array of transducer elements.
The method uses a different sub-aperture 1-3 in the array 20 to transmit a plurality of beam-formed ultrasound signals associated with each transmission, and to receive reflected ultrasound signals, Providing DAS beamforming under the transmission of a plurality of separate sub-apertures. A coherence factor is calculated based on the percentage of coherent energy in the received time-delayed signal from each sub-aperture transmission. All beamforming imaging under a defined sub-aperture transmission is weighted with adaptive coherence and combined into the final beamforming output.
[Selection] Figure 2

abstracts.paragraph_markup:
The present invention provides a new method of synthetic ultrasonic imaging that can improve the method of plane wave synthetic ultrasonic imaging.
A method of ultrasonic imaging is at least a transmission step, wherein a plurality of ultrasonic waves are transmitted to an imaging region, and each set of raw data is acquired by an array 2 of transducers corresponding to the respective ultrasonic waves. The ultrasonic wave has various spatial frequency components and a coherence enhancement step, and at least one set of coherent data is obtained from each set of raw data for each of a plurality of provisional transmission focal zones in the imaging region. And a phasing process in which image pixels are calculated by phasing using a set of coherent data for each of a plurality of locations included in each provisional transmission focal region.

PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a new method for ultrasound synthetic imaging capable of improving a method for plane ultrasound synthetic imaging.SOLUTION: A method for ultrasound imaging comprises at least the following steps: a transmission step in which a plurality of ultrasonic waves are transmitted into an imaged region and a set of raw data is acquired by an array 2 of transducers in response to each ultrasonic wave, the ultrasonic waves having different spatial frequency content; a coherence enhancing step in which, for each of a plurality of virtual transmission focal zones in the imaged region, at least one set of coherent data is synthesized from the sets of raw data; and a beamforming step in which, for each of a plurality of locations included in each of the virtual transmission focal zones, an image pixel is computed by beamforming, using the set of coherent data.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 2

【課題】平面波合成超音波イメージングの方法の改善を可能とする新しい合成超音波イメージングの方法を提供する。
【解決手段】超音波イメージングの方法は少なくとも、送信工程であって、複数の超音波が画像化領域へ送信され、それぞれのローデータの集合はそれぞれの超音波に応じたトランスデューサのアレイ２によって取得され、超音波はさまざまな空間周波数成分を有するものと、コヒーレンス向上工程であって、画像化領域の複数の仮の送信焦点域それぞれについて、ローデータの各集合から少なくとも一のコヒーレントデータの集合が合成されるものと、整相工程であって、それぞれの仮の送信焦点域に含まれる複数の場所それぞれについて、イメージ画素がコヒーレントデータの集合を利用した整相によって演算されるものとを備える。
【選択図】図２

PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To visualize a plurality of joint surfaces of a workpiece at the same time.SOLUTION: An ultrasonic imaging device 4 comprises: a signal processing unit 46 for irradiating a workpiece 1 with an ultrasonic wave of prescribed frequency by a probe 2, applying a gating process to the reflected wave of the ultrasonic wave detected by the probe 2, and outputting a displacement of the reflected wave on two joint surfaces of the workpiece 1; an image generation unit 47 for generating the image of each of two joint surfaces on the basis of the displacement of each reflected wave at the two joint surfaces; and a height adjustment unit 41 for adjusting the height of the probe 2. The height adjustment unit 41 sets the focus of the probe 2 between the two joint surfaces by adjusting the height of the probe 2.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 1

A plurality of joint surfaces of a workpiece are simultaneously imaged.
An ultrasonic imaging device 4 irradiates a workpiece 1 with ultrasonic waves of a predetermined frequency by a probe 2 and performs gate processing on the reflected ultrasonic waves detected by the probe 2 to thereby couple the workpiece 1 at two joint surfaces. The height of the signal processing unit 46 that outputs the displacement of the reflected wave, the image generation unit 47 that generates each image of the two bonded surfaces, and the height of the probe 2 based on the displacement of each reflected wave at the two bonded surfaces And a height adjusting unit 41. The height adjustment unit 41 sets the focal point of the probe 2 between the two joint surfaces by adjusting the height of the probe 2.

titles.text: System and method for ultrasonic beamforming using coherent composite Fresnel focusing
コヒーレント複合フレネルフォーカシングを使用した超音波ビームフォーミングのためのシステム及び方法

abstracts.paragraph_markup: 選択された仰角におけるフレネル仰角フォーカシングが、フレネルフォーカシング超音波パルスの連続的な組を送信することによって行われ、各パルスに対して異なるフレネル位相パターンが使用され、受信信号がコヒーレントに複合される。異なるフレネルパターンは、二次ローブ領域における圧力場の変動を平均化することによって、二次ローブのエネルギを低減する。幾つかの実施形態において、コヒーレント複合フレネルフォーカシングの方法は、方位角方向におけるコヒーレントに複合されたデフォーカス波（例えば、平面波又は発散波）イメージングと組み合わせられる。各仰角スライスは、一連の平面波又は発散波が送信されるときにそれぞれ使用されるフレネルパターンを変更することによって収集され、これにより、コヒーレント複合は、両方の平面に同時に利益をもたらすことができる。アダマール受信符号化及びこれに続く動的受信ビームフォーミングを用いて、仰角方向の性能を更に改善してもよい。【選択図】図８

Fresnel elevation focusing at a selected elevation is performed by transmitting a continuous set of Fresnel focusing ultrasound pulses, using a different Fresnel phase pattern for each pulse and coherently combining the received signal. The different Fresnel patterns reduce the energy of the secondary lobe by averaging the variation of the pressure field in the secondary lobe region. In some embodiments, the method of coherent combined Fresnel focusing is combined with coherently combined defocused wave (eg, plane or divergent) imaging in the azimuthal direction. Each elevation slice is collected by altering the Fresnel pattern used when a series of plane or divergent waves are transmitted, respectively, so that coherent combining can benefit both planes simultaneously. Elevation performance may be further improved using Hadamard receive coding followed by dynamic receive beamforming. [Selection diagram] FIG.

titles.text: Ultrasound imaging with sparse sampling and related equipment, systems and methods
疎サンプリングによる超音波撮像ならびに関連する装置、システムおよび方法

abstracts.paragraph_markup: 疎（スパース）サンプリングによる超音波撮像のためのシステム、装置及び方法が提供される。一実施形態において、超音波撮像システムは、超音波トランスデューサ素子のアレイと、該超音波トランスデューサ素子のアレイと通信すると共に複数の連続した超音波トランスデューサ素子及び少なくとも１つの連続しない超音波トランスデューサ素子を有する該アレイの第１の受信開口を選択するように構成された電子回路と、該電子回路と通信するビーム形成器と、を有する。第１の受信開口の各超音波トランスデューサ素子は、反射超音波エコーを受信すると共に撮像データを表す電気信号を生成するように構成される。前記ビーム形成器は、第１の受信開口によって生成された電気信号を受信し、連続する超音波トランスデューサ素子によって生成された電気信号及び少なくとも１つの連続しない超音波トランスデューサ素子によって生成された電気信号に異なる重みを付与するように構成される。

Systems, devices and methods for ultrasound imaging by sparse sampling are provided. In one embodiment, the ultrasonic imaging system has an array of ultrasonic transducer elements and a plurality of continuous ultrasonic transducer elements and at least one non-continuous ultrasonic transducer element that communicate with the array of ultrasonic transducer elements. It has an electronic circuit configured to select the first receive aperture of the array and a beam transducer that communicates with the electronic circuit. Each ultrasonic transducer element in the first receiving aperture is configured to receive a reflected ultrasonic echo and generate an electrical signal representing imaging data. The beam former receives the electrical signal generated by the first reception aperture and combines it into an electrical signal generated by a continuous ultrasonic transducer element and an electrical signal generated by at least one non-continuous ultrasonic transducer element. It is configured to give different weights.

titles.text: Methods and equipment for selecting the power state of the ultrasound imaging system
超音波撮像システムの電力状態を選択する方法及び装置

abstracts.paragraph_markup: The ultrasound imaging system includes a processor programmed to operate the system in normal operating conditions and two or more low power conditions. When the processor detects one or more operating conditions, such as the tissue not being imaged within a predetermined time limit, or the imaging system or transducer not being moved within the time limit, the operating power state is lowered. Lower to the state. When restarting from a power-off state, the processor runs a lower power state before operating in the normal operating state to avoid wasting power until the transducer is placed in a position to image the tissue. [Selection diagram] Fig. 3

超音波撮像システムが、通常動作状態と２以上の低電力状態でシステムを動作させるようにプログラムされたプロセッサを含む。プロセッサは、所定の制限時間内に組織が撮像されなかった、又は画像システムまたはトランスデューサが制限時間内に移動されなかった、というような１以上の動作条件を検出すると、動作電力状態をより低い電力状態へ下げる。電力が切断された状態から再起動するとき、プロセッサは通常動作状態で動作する前により低い電力状態を実行して、トランスデューサが組織を撮像する位置に配置されるまでの無駄な電力消費を避ける。

titles.text: Ultrasonic method and equipment
超音波方法及び装置

abstracts.paragraph_markup: 記載の態様及び実施形態は、超音波方法と、その方法を実行するように動作可能な超音波装置及びコンピュータプログラム製品と、を提供する。超音波方法は、信号を一致領域内へ送信するように２又は３以上の別個の超音波送信機を構成するステップと、２又は３以上の送信機のそれぞれからの送信信号が一致領域内にある媒体と相互作用した後、送信信号を表す波面を受信するように受信アレイを構成するステップと、２又は３以上の別個の超音波送信機のそれぞれの相対的空間位置を決定するために、受信された波面のそれぞれを分析するステップと、２又は３以上の別個の超音波送信機のそれぞれの決定された相対的空間位置を用いて、送信信号が一致領域内にある媒体と相互作用した後、２又は３以上の送信機のそれぞれから受信アレイで受信された波面のコヒーレント信号結合を実行するステップと、を含む。したがって、いくつかの実施形態においては、この方法で、マルチトランスデューサ超音波イメージングシステムを提供することが、最終画像をビームフォーミングするためにシステムにおけるトランスデューサを正確に位置特定する堅牢な方法を提供することによって可能になる。記載の方法及び装置により、分解能、深度透過率、コントラスト及び信号対ノイズ比（ＳＮＲ）の観点における画質の改善が可能になる。

The described embodiments and embodiments provide an ultrasonic method and an ultrasonic device and computer program product that can operate to perform the method. The ultrasonic method involves configuring two or three or more separate ultrasonic transmitters to transmit the signal into the matching region, and transmitting signals from each of the two or three or more transmitters within the matching region. To determine the relative spatial position of each of two or three or more distinct ultrasonic transmitters, as well as the steps to configure the receive array to receive the wavefront representing the transmit signal after interacting with a medium. Using the step of analyzing each of the received wavefronts and the determined relative spatial position of each of two or more separate ultrasonic transmitters, the transmitted signal interacted with the medium within the matching region. Later, it comprises performing a coherent signal coupling of the wavefront received in the receiving array from each of the two or three or more transmitters. Therefore, in some embodiments, providing a multi-transducer ultrasound imaging system in this way provides a robust way to accurately position the transducer in the system for beamforming the final image. Makes it possible. The methods and devices described allow for improved image quality in terms of resolution, depth transmission, contrast and signal-to-noise ratio (SNR).

titles.text: Systems and methods for tagging and associating acoustic images
音響画像にタグを付けて関連付けるためのシステム及び方法

abstracts.paragraph_markup: あるシステムは、音響信号を受信するように構成された音響センサアレイと、電磁放射を受信するように構成された電磁撮像ツールと、位置情報を出力するように構成された位置センサと、メモリと、プロセッサを含む。プロセッサは、音響センサアレイから音響データを受信し、受信した音響データから音響画像データを生成することができる。プロセッサは、電磁撮像ツールから電磁画像データを受信し、生成された音響画像データと受信した電磁画像データとを組み合わせて、ディスプレイ画像を生成することができる。プロセッサは、位置センサから位置情報を受信し、受信した位置情報に関連付けられたディスプレイ画像をメモリに保存することができる。位置情報は、ディスプレイ画像のメタデータで保存され得るか、又はディスプレイ画像内に表示され得る。プロセッサは、そのような画像に関連付けられた位置情報に基づくなどして、メモリに記憶された画像を関連付けるように構成され得る。

One system includes an acoustic sensor array configured to receive acoustic signals, an electromagnetic imaging tool configured to receive electromagnetic radiation, a position sensor configured to output location information, and a memory. , Including the processor. The processor can receive acoustic data from the acoustic sensor array and generate acoustic image data from the received acoustic data. The processor can receive electromagnetic image data from an electromagnetic imaging tool and combine the generated acoustic image data with the received electromagnetic image data to generate a display image. The processor can receive the position information from the position sensor and store the display image associated with the received position information in the memory. The location information can be stored in the metadata of the display image or can be displayed within the display image. The processor may be configured to associate an image stored in memory, such as based on the location information associated with such an image.

titles.text: Systems and methods for projecting and displaying acoustic data
音響データを投射および表示するためのシステム及び方法

abstracts.paragraph_markup: システムは、音響信号を受信するように構成された音響センサアレイと、電磁放射を放射するように構成されている照明器と、電磁放射を受信するように構成された電磁撮像ツールと、距離測定ツールと、プロセッサを含む。プロセッサは、照明器を介してターゲットシーンに照明を当て、電磁撮像ツールから照明を当てられたシーンを示す電磁画像データを受信し、音響センサアレイから音響データを受信し、距離測定ツールから距離情報を受信することができる。プロセッサは、さらに、受信した音響データと受信した距離情報に基づき、シーンの音響画像データを生成し、組み合わされた音響画像データと電磁画像データからなるディスプレイ画像を生成するように構成され得る。プロセッサは、シーン内の様々な音響信号の奥行を決定し、間取り図や体積表現を含む、決定された奥行を示すシーンの表現を生成することができる。

The system consists of an acoustic sensor array configured to receive acoustic signals, an illuminator configured to emit electromagnetic radiation, an electromagnetic imaging tool configured to receive electromagnetic radiation, and distance measurements. Includes tools and processor. The processor illuminates the target scene through the illuminator, receives electromagnetic image data indicating the illuminated scene from the electromagnetic imaging tool, receives acoustic data from the acoustic sensor array, and distance information from the distance measurement tool. Can be received. The processor may be further configured to generate acoustic image data of the scene based on the received acoustic data and received distance information, and to generate a display image consisting of the combined acoustic image data and electromagnetic image data. The processor can determine the depth of various acoustic signals in the scene and generate a representation of the scene showing the determined depth, including floor plans and volumetric representations.

One system includes an acoustic sensor array configured to receive acoustic signals, an electromagnetic imaging tool configured to receive electromagnetic radiation, a user interface, a display, and a processor. The processor receives electromagnetic data from the electromagnetic imaging tool and acoustic data from the acoustic sensor array. The processor generates acoustic image data of the scene based on the received acoustic data, generates a display image consisting of the combined acoustic image data and electromagnetic image data, and provides the display image to the display. The processor can receive annotation input from the user interface and update the display image based on the received annotation input. The processor may be configured to determine one or more acoustic parameters associated with the received acoustic signal and to determine the criticality associated with the acoustic signal. The user can annotate the display image with defined critical information or other defined information.

The acoustic imaging system may include an acoustic sensor array, an electromagnetic imaging tool, a display, and an audio device. The processor can receive data from the acoustic sensor array and the electromagnetic imaging tool and generate a display image that combines the acoustic image data and the electromagnetic image data. The system may include an audio device that receives audio output from the processor and outputs an audio feedback signal to the user. The audio feedback signal can represent an acoustic signal from an acoustic scene. The system can provide the user with a display image containing the acoustic image data, and the user can select an acoustic signal that provides the corresponding audio output to the audio device. The audio output and the display image can be dynamically changed in response to changes in the pointing of the acoustic sensor array, for example by changing the stereo audio output.

Some systems include electromagnetic imaging tools, communication interfaces, electromagnetic imaging tools and processors that communicate with communication interfaces, and enclosures that are configured to receive electromagnetic radiation. The system may include a first sensor head having a first plurality of acoustic sensor elements arranged in the first acoustic sensor array. The communication interface may provide communication between the processor and the sensor head via wired or wireless communication. The communication interface may include a docking port for communicating with the processor and may be removably configured to be the receiver of the corresponding docking mechanism of the first sensor head. Some systems may include a second sensor head with a second plurality of acoustic sensor elements. The second sensor head may be interchangeably connectable to the communication interface and / or the first sensor head.

titles.text: 複数のオブジェクトタイプのためのメタデータ生成
Metadata generation for multiple object types

abstracts.paragraph_markup: メタデータ計算装置（５６）は、ホストインタフェース（６８）、ストレージインタフェース（６０）および１または複数のプロセッサ（６４）を含む。ホストインタフェースは、コンピュータネットワーク（２８）を介して１または複数のリモートホスト（２４）と通信するように構成される。ストレージインタフェースは、１または複数のストレージデバイス（４４）の１または複数の不揮発性メモリ（５２）と通信するように構成される。プロセッサは、不揮発性メモリにおけるメディアオブジェクトのローカル格納または検索を管理することと、ストレージデバイスに格納されたまたは格納される途中の複数のメディアオブジェクトのメタデータを計算することであって、ここで、メディアオブジェクトは複数のメディアタイプであり、計算されたメタデータは、複数のメディアタイプのうち少なくとも２つの異なるメディアタイプのメディアオブジェクトにおけるターゲットフィーチャをタグ付けする、計算することと、不揮発性メモリに、少なくとも２つの異なるメディアタイプで見られるターゲットフィーチャをタグ付けするメタデータを、ホストによる使用のために格納することとを行うように構成される。

The metadata calculator (56) includes a host interface (68), a storage interface (60) and one or more processors (64). The host interface is configured to communicate with one or more remote hosts (24) via the computer network (28). The storage interface is configured to communicate with one or more non-volatile memories (52) of one or more storage devices (44). The processor manages the local storage or retrieval of media objects in non-volatile memory and computes the metadata of multiple media objects stored or in the process of being stored in the storage device. Media objects are multiple media types, and the calculated metadata is used to tag, calculate, and non-volatile memory the target features in media objects of at least two different media types out of multiple media types. It is configured to store metadata for tagging target features found in at least two different media types for use by the host.

abstracts.paragraph_markup: 本開示は、メタデータ演算制御を有するストレージアグリゲータコントローラを説明する。ストレージアグリゲータコントローラは、ホストインタフェースを介して、コンピュータネットワークを介して１または複数のリモートホストと通信を行い、ストレージデバイスインタフェースを介して、リモートホストとは別の、それぞれの不揮発性メモリを有する複数のローカルストレージデバイスとも通信を行う。ストレージアグリゲータコントローラは、メディアオブジェクトの格納または検索のためにローカルストレージデバイスを管理する。ストレージアグリゲータコントローラは、アグリゲータ制御回路またはストレージデバイスの１または複数のストレージデバイスコントローラにおいて、複数のストレージデバイスから検索された、または複数のストレージデバイスにおける格納のために、コンピュータネットワークを介して１または複数のホストから受信されたメディアオブジェクトのコンテンツの特徴を規定するメタデータの選択的演算をも統制する。

The present disclosure describes a storage aggregator controller with metadata arithmetic control. A storage aggregator controller communicates with one or more remote hosts over a computer network via a host interface, and over a storage device interface, multiple remote hosts with their own non-volatile memory. It also communicates with local storage devices. The storage aggregator controller manages local storage devices for storing or retrieving media objects. A storage aggregator controller is an aggregator control circuit or one or more storage device controllers over a computer network that is retrieved from multiple storage devices or stored in multiple storage devices in one or more storage device controllers. It also controls the selective computation of metadata that characterizes the content of media objects received from the host.

titles.text: Systems and methods for generating metadata that describes unstructured data objects at the storage edge

abstracts.paragraph_markup: ストレージデバイスに結合され、かつ、ホストデバイスから遠く離れて配置される、ストレージ制御デバイスが、ホストデバイスからメディアオブジェクトデータを受信する。ストレージ制御デバイスは、メディアオブジェクトデータのタイプを識別し、識別されたタイプに基づいて、ストレージ制御デバイスの計算エンジンにより使用される複数の計算モデルの中から計算モデルを選択する。計算エンジンは、選択された計算モデルを使用して、メディアオブジェクトデータを記述するメタデータを生成する。メタデータは、メディアオブジェクトデータとは別個にストレージデバイスから選択的に検索できるようにストレージデバイスに記憶される。

A storage control device that is coupled to the storage device and located far away from the host device receives media object data from the host device. The storage control device identifies the type of media object data and selects a computational model from among multiple computational models used by the storage control device's computational engine based on the identified type. The calculation engine uses the selected calculation model to generate metadata that describes the media object data. Metadata is stored in the storage device so that it can be selectively retrieved from the storage device separately from the media object data.

titles.text: 3D ultrasound imaging with wide focused transmit beam at high display frame rate
高い表示フレームレートで幅広集束送信ビームを用いる３Ｄ超音波イメージング

abstracts.paragraph_markup: 超音波システムは、高い表示フレームレートで３Ｄ画像を生成する。ボリュメトリック領域が、平面波又は発散送信ビームで走査されて、各送信イベントで、ボリュメトリック領域の大部分又は全体が超音波照射される。方位角及び仰角ディメンジョンにおけるクラッタ信号を取得しないように、平面波又は発散ビームは、仰角方向と方位角方向との中間の角度で送信される。それぞれ仰角方向と方位角方向との両方の組み合わせである複数の異なる角度で平面波又は発散ビームを送信することにより、結果として得られる合成画像におけるサイドローブクラッタが低減される。

超音波システムは、高い表示フレームレートで３Ｄ画像を生成する。ボリュメトリック領域が、平面波又は発散送信ビームで走査されて、各送信イベントで、ボリュメトリック領域の大部分又は全体が超音波照射される。方位角及び仰角ディメンジョンにおけるクラッタ信号を取得しないように、平面波又は発散ビームは、仰角方向と方位角方向との中間の角度で送信される。それぞれ仰角方向と方位角方向との両方の組み合わせである複数の異なる角度で平面波又は発散ビームを送信することにより、結果として得られる合成画像におけるサイドローブクラッタが低減される。

Ultrasound systems produce 3D images at high display frame rates. The volumetric region is scanned with a plane wave or divergent transmit beam, and at each transmit event, most or all of the volumetric region is ultrasonically irradiated. The plane wave or divergent beam is transmitted at an angle between the elevation and azimuth directions so as not to acquire the clutter signal at the azimuth and elevation dimensions. By transmitting plane waves or divergent beams at a plurality of different angles, each of which is a combination of both elevation and azimuth, sidelobe clutter in the resulting composite image is reduced.

titles.text: Metadata generation at the storage edge
ストレージエッジにおけるメタデータ生成

abstracts.paragraph_markup: The controller (56) for use in the storage device (44, 114) of the data processing system (20, 90) comprises a host interface (68), a memory interface (60), and one or more processors (64). include. The host interface is configured to communicate with one or more remote hosts (24, 102) in the data processing system via the computer network (28, 98). The memory interface is configured to communicate locally with the non-volatile memory (52) of the storage device. One or more processors manage the local storage or retrieval of the media object (80) in non-volatile memory and define the content characteristics of the media object stored or stored in non-volatile memory. It is configured to selectively calculate the metadata (84).

abstracts.paragraph_markup: 空間内に定義された位置およびジオメトリを有する空間的に拡張された音源を再生するための装置であって、前記装置は、リスナー位置を受信するためのインターフェース（１００）と、リスナー位置、空間的に拡張された音源のジオメトリに関する情報および空間的に拡張された音源の位置に関する情報を使用して、空間的に拡張された音源に関連付けられた二次元または三次元の凸包の投影面への投影を計算するためのプロジェクタ（１２０）と、投影面を使用して、空間的に拡張された音源について少なくとも２つの音源の位置を計算するための音位置計算機（１４０）と、前記位置で少なくとも２つの音源をレンダリングして、２つ以上の出力信号を有する空間的に拡張された音源の再生を得るためのレンダラ（１６０）であって、レンダラ（１６０）は異なる位置に対して異なる音信号を使用するように構成され、異なる音信号は空間的に拡張された音源に関連付けられる、レンダラ（１６０）と、を含む。【選択図】図９

titles.text: 超音波撮像システム及び方法
Ultrasound imaging system and method
ULTRASONIC IMAGING SYSTEM AND METHOD

abstracts.paragraph_markup:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a system and a method for increasing an operation time and/or a standby time of an ultrasonic imaging system by reducing consumed power when the ultrasonic imaging system is not imaging a tissue, when it is not operated for a certain period, or when the temperature of a transducer increases over a permissible level.

SOLUTION: An ultrasonic imaging system includes a processor programmed so as to operate a system in a normal operation state and in two or more low power states. Upon detection of one or more operation conditions that a tissue is not imaged within a predetermined time limit or that an image system or a transducer is not moved within a time limit, etc., the processor decreases an operation power state to a lower power state. When the power is restarted from a cut-off state, the processor executes a lower power state before operating the system in the normal operation state, and avoids wasteful power consumption until the transducer is disposed at a position for imaging the tissue.

SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 3

COPYRIGHT: (C)2023,JPO&INPIT

Kind Code: A1 By reducing the power consumed when an ultrasound imaging system is not imaging tissue, when it has not been moved for a period of time, or when the transducer is unacceptably warm, A system and method are provided for increasing the operating time and/or standby time of an ultrasound imaging system. An ultrasound imaging system includes a processor programmed to operate the system in a normal operating state and two or more low power states. The processor changes the operating power state to a lower power state upon detecting one or more operating conditions, such as no tissue has been imaged within a predetermined time limit, or the imaging system or transducer has not been moved within a predetermined time limit. state down. When resuming from a power-off state, the processor executes a lower power state before operating in a normal operating state to avoid wasting power until the transducer is positioned to image tissue. [Selection drawing] Fig. 3

【課題】超音波撮像システムが組織を撮像していないとき、ある期間動かされていないとき、又はトランスデューサが許容以上に温度が上がっているとき、などに、消費される電力を低減することにより、超音波撮像システムの動作時間及び／又はスタンバイ時間を増加させるためのシステム及び方法を提供する。
【解決手段】超音波撮像システムが、通常動作状態と２以上の低電力状態でシステムを動作させるようにプログラムされたプロセッサを含む。プロセッサは、所定の制限時間内に組織が撮像されなかった、又は画像システム又はトランスデューサが制限時間内に移動されなかった、というような１以上の動作条件を検出すると、動作電力状態をより低い電力状態へ下げる。電力が切断された状態から再起動するとき、プロセッサは通常動作状態で動作する前により低い電力状態を実行して、トランスデューサが組織を撮像する位置に配置されるまでの無駄な電力消費を避ける。
【選択図】図３

titles.text: Metadata generation for multiple object types
複数のオブジェクトタイプのためのメタデータ生成

abstracts.paragraph_markup: A metadata calculation device including a plurality of processors is provided. In the metadata computing apparatus, a storage interface communicates with one or more non-volatile memories of one or more storage devices, a processor manages local storage or retrieval of media objects in the non-volatile memory; Computing metadata for a plurality of media objects that are stored or in the process of being stored on a storage device. The media object is of a plurality of media types, and the computed metadata tags target features in the media object of at least two different media types of the plurality of media types. The processor further stores in non-volatile memory metadata tagging target features found in at least two different media types for use by the host. [Selection diagram] Figure 4

To provide a metadata computation apparatus including a plurality of processors.SOLUTION: In a metadata computation apparatus, a storage interface is configured to communicate with one or more non-volatile memories of one or more storage devices, and processors are configured to manage local storage or retrieval of media objects in the non-volatile memories, to compute metadata for a plurality of media objects that are stored, or are en-route for storage, on the storage devices. The media objects are of multiple media types. The computed metadata tags a target feature in the media objects of at least two different media types among the multiple media types. The processors are configured to store, in the non-volatile memories, the metadata tagging the target feature found in the at least two different media types, for use by hosts.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 4

【課題】複数のプロセッサを含むメタデータ計算装置を提供する。
【解決手段】メタデータ計算装置において、ストレージインタフェースは、１又は複数のストレージデバイスの１又は複数の不揮発性メモリと通信し、プロセッサは、不揮発性メモリにおけるメディアオブジェクトのローカル格納又は検索を管理し、ストレージデバイスに格納されるか又は格納される途中の複数のメディアオブジェクトのメタデータを計算する。メディアオブジェクトは、複数のメディアタイプであり、計算されたメタデータは、複数のメディアタイプのうち少なくとも２つの異なるメディアタイプのメディアオブジェクトにおけるターゲットフィーチャをタグ付ける。プロセッサはさらに、不揮発性メモリに、少なくとも２つの異なるメディアタイプで見られるターゲットフィーチャをタグ付けするメタデータを、ホストによる使用のために格納する。
【選択図】図４
